name: Zib VisualFunction
title: HCIM VisualFunction
description:
An Observation resource as defined by the Dutch Health and Care Information models (Dutch: Zorginformatiebouwsteen or ZIB) VisualFunction v3.1(2017EN).

Sight is the ability to observe lit objects, with the goal of orienting yourself on objects and people in a lit environment. This pertains to observing the light stimuli, and not processing them in the brain.
A sight disorder can lead to things including orientation problems.
purpose:
# Purpose of HCIM
Information on visual function disorders is important in patient care and treatment and particularly in the communication with the patient. Based on this information, healthcare can be adjusted to the patientâ€™s limitations if needed.

# Purpose of this resource
This HCIM is is not meant to track the overaching condition but make an observation about the visual disorders in the context of communication with the patient. It is complemented by the zib-VisualFunction-VisualAid (DeviceUseStatement) and zib-VisualFunction-VisualAidProduct (Device) profiles to score information about the use of any visual aids.
